title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2.12 - Executive Order No. 12: Amending the Executive Order of July 29, 1974 establishing the Interdepartmental Commission on Services to Children and Youth
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2.12 - Executive Order No. 12: Amending the Executive Order of July 29, 1974 establishing the Interdepartmental Commission on Services to Children and Youth

State Regulations
I, Malcolm Wilson, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State
of New York, do hereby direct by Executive Order that the initial paragraph of
the Executive Order of July 29, 1974, establishing the Interdepartmental

Commission on Services to Children and Youth, be amended as follows: During the past year, the heads of State agencies concerned
with providing services to juvenile delinquents, young people in need of
supervision, neglected, abused and dependent youth and children with
handicapping conditions have been meeting informally to coordinate their
efforts and the efforts of local units subject to their supervision in the
provision of such services. To encourage the continued development of creative
and imaginative programs in these vital areas, I, Malcolm Wilson, Governor of
the State of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the

Constitution and laws of the State of New York, do hereby formally establish in
the Executive Department an interdepartmental commission, to be known as the

Interdepartmental Commission on Services to Children and Youth, to consist of
the Commissioners of Mental Hygiene, Education, Health, Social Services, and

Criminal Justice Services, the Executive Director of the Board of Social

Welfare, the Chairman of the Drug Abuse Control Commission, and the Directors
of the Division for Youth, the Division of Probation and the Office of Planning

Services. Signed: Malcolm A. Wilson

Dated: October 3, 1974

Notes

2.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
